title: Nanoparticle Characterization with In Situ AFM-SEM-EDS
content: Nanoparticles (NPs) have broad applications in biological, medical, and pharmaceutical sciences, such as bio-separation, biosensing, diagnostics, and drug delivery [1-2]. Because the functionality of NPs is highly dependent on their sizes, shape, surface, and material, the accurate characterization of particles is essential to their specific applications [3]. In this work, we studied the feasibility of NPs characterization in terms of topography and material composition by FusionScopeTM, a novel correlative microscope platform that seamless combines a wide range of Atomic Force Microscope (AFM) measurement techniques with the benefits of Scanning Electron Microscopy (SEM) imaging.
